raft.jpct.bones
Class AnimatedGroup

java.lang.Object
  raft.jpct.bones.AnimatedGroup
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Animated3D>
public class AnimatedGroup
extends Object
implements Serializable, Iterable<Animated3D>, Cloneable

Helper class to group Animated3D's and manipulate them easily.

Author:
hakan eryargi (r a f t)
See Also:

Constructor Detail

AnimatedGroup

public AnimatedGroup(Animated3D... objects)
Creates a new AnimatedGroup out of given objects. All objects must have the same Skeleton.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if object array is empty or they have different skeletons.
See Also:
Animated3D.mergeAnimations(Animated3D...)
Method Detail

getRoot

public Object3D getRoot()
Returns root object that all animated objects are added as child. Root object is a dummy object, it isn't added to world. To translate/rotate the whole group, it's enough to apply translation/rotation to root object.

get

public Animated3D get(int index)
Returns the specified object

get

public Animated3D get(String name)
Returns the first object with given name.

Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if object not found

Adds all animated objects to world.

See Also:

public void removeFromWorld(World world)
Removes all animated objects to world.

World.removeObject(Object3D)

getSkinClipSequence

public SkinClipSequence getSkinClipSequence()

Returns the assigned ClipSequence if any.

setSkinClipSequence

public void setSkinClipSequence(SkinClipSequence clipSequence)

Sets the SkinClipSequence of this group. The skeleton of ClipSequence must be the same of this group.

This method is analogue of Object3D.setAnimationSequence(com.threed.jpct.Animation).

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if given ClipSequence has a different Skeleton
See Also:
mergeAnimations(AnimatedGroup...)

getPoseClipSequence

public PoseClipSequence getPoseClipSequence()

Returns the assigned ClipSequence if any.

setPoseClipSequence

public void setPoseClipSequence(PoseClipSequence poseClipSequence)

Sets the SkinClipSequence of this group. The skeleton of ClipSequence must be the same of this group.

This method is analogue of Object3D.setAnimationSequence(com.threed.jpct.Animation).

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if given ClipSequence has a different Skeleton
See Also:
mergeAnimations(AnimatedGroup...)

animateSkin

public void animateSkin(float index,
                        int sequence)

Animates this object group using assigned SkinClipSequence. Updates curentPose once and if "auto apply animation" is enabled calls Animated3D.applySkeletonPose() on each of objects.

This method behaves similar to Object3D.animate(float, int).

See Also:
SkinClipSequence, Animated3D.animateSkin(float, int), setAutoApplyAnimation(boolean), Object3D.animate(float, int)

applySkeletonPose

public void applySkeletonPose()

calls Animated3D.applySkeletonPose() on each of objects.

See Also:
Animated3D.applySkeletonPose()

setSkeletonPose

public void setSkeletonPose(SkeletonPose currentPose)

calls Animated3D.setSkeletonPose(SkeletonPose) on each of objects.

See Also:
Animated3D.setSkeletonPose(SkeletonPose)

isAutoApplyAnimation

public boolean isAutoApplyAnimation()
Returns if animateXX methods are automatically applied.

See Also:
animatePose(float, int), animateSkin(float, int)

setAutoApplyAnimation

public void setAutoApplyAnimation(boolean autoApplyAnimation)

Sets if animateXX methods are automatically applied. Also calls setAutoApplyAnimation on each of objects. Default is true.

To enable animation blending automatic applying must be disabled.

See Also:
animatePose(float, int), animateSkin(float, int)

setVisibility

public void setVisibility(boolean visible)
Sets visibility of all objects in group.

applyAnimation

public void applyAnimation()

Calls applyAnimation() on each of objects.

See Also:
Animated3D.applyAnimation()

resetAnimation

public void resetAnimation()

calls resetAnimation() on each of objects.

See Also:
Animated3D.resetAnimation()

animatePose

public void animatePose(float index,
                        int sequence)
Same as animatePose(float, int, 1)

animatePose

public void animatePose(float index,
                        int sequence,
                        float weight)

Animates this group using assigned PoseClipSequence. Updates curentPose and if "auto apply animation" is enabled calls applySkeletonPose()

Pose animations are cumulative if "auto apply animation" is disabled. Each call to this method cancels previous skin animation.

Parameters:
sequence - the number of PoseClip in PoseClipSequence. 1 is the first sequence. 0 means whole PoseClipSequence
index - time index
weight - how much animation will be applied. 1 means as it is
See Also:
SkinClipSequence, Object3D.animate(float, int), setAutoApplyAnimation(boolean)

iterator

public Iterator<Animated3D> iterator()
Returns an iterator of Animated3D objects.

Specified by:
iterator in interface Iterable<Animated3D>

getSize

public int getSize()
returns number of objects in this group

mergeAnimations

public static AnimatedGroup mergeAnimations(AnimatedGroup... groups)

Merge many identical AnimatedGroups with different animations into one. This method does not require all AnimatedGroups share the same Skeleton but skeletons are almost identical.

If many AnimatedGroups are loaded from different files, their skeleton objects will be different even if they are identical. This method is meant to help such cases.

This method always uses the skeleton of first group.

See Also:
Animated3D.mergeAnimations(Animated3D...), SkinClipSequence.merge(SkinClipSequence...)

clone

public AnimatedGroup clone()
Same as clone(MESH_REUSE)

Overrides:
clone in class Object
See Also:
clone(boolean)

clone

public AnimatedGroup clone(boolean reuseMesh)

Clones this object group. Skeleton, SkeletonPose, SkinClipSequence PoseClipSequence will be shared. If the mesh is reused, the clone and master will inherit animations from each other.

See Also:
Animated3D.Animated3D(Animated3D, boolean), MESH_REUSE, MESH_DONT_REUSE
